content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 4 minus t squared"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals sin open parentheses t over 2 close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>. An object follows the path defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> for time <math alttext="1 less or equal than t less or equal than 2"><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></math> seconds. As the object starts moving at time <math alttext="t equals 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> second, which of the following describes its initial direction?

choices.label: The object starts moving up and to the right.
The object starts moving up and to the left.
The object starts moving down and to the right.
The object starts moving down and to the left.

content.answer: The object starts moving up and to the left.
